As an AI language model, I can provide you with some examples of how companies have been adapting to changes in customer behavior during the pandemic.

1. Increased emphasis on e-commerce: With more people staying at home and avoiding in-person shopping due to the pandemic, many companies have shifted their focus to e-commerce channels to reach customers. This has resulted in new partnerships, delivery options, and increased online advertising.

2. Contactless Payment Options: Many businesses have added contactless payment options in response to customers who are more concerned about sanitary conditions. This includes mobile payment solutions like Apple Pay, Google Wallet, PayPal, and others.

3. Virtual experiences: Companies have adapted to the pandemic by creating virtual experiences to connect with their customers. This includes digital events, virtual product launches, and online consultations to maintain face-to-face interactions.

4. Safety measures: Companies have invested in various measures to ensure customer safety. This includes mandatory face masks, hand sanitizing stations, and limited occupancy in physical locations.

5. Flexibility: Organizations have been more flexible in accommodating customer needs during the pandemic. This includes flexible cancellation policies, waived cancellation fees, and free reservations to provide customers with more reassurance.

In conclusion, businesses have adapted quickly to the changing customer behavior patterns resulting from the pandemic. Many of these changes are geared towards accommodating customers' requirements for safety, flexibility, and convenience with a shift towards digital channels as a means of communicating, selling, and delivering products and services.
